meanings.definition: A sudden fear or distressing suspense caused by an awareness of danger.
meanings.sent1: The loud alarm startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent2: The alarm went off when the fire broke out.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock rang so loudly that it scared the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her heart raced with alarm as she heard footsteps behind her.
meanings.sent5: The alarm blared, sending shivers down his spine.

meanings.definition: A device that gives a loud warning signal in response to danger.
meanings.sent1: The alarm on the car alerted the neighbors to the break-in.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to set the alarm before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The alarm system was so sensitive, even a squirrel could trigger it.
meanings.sent4: The alarm wailed like a banshee in the night.
meanings.sent5: The alarm's shrill sound pierced the silence of the room.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel frightened or worried.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected noise will alarm the baby.
meanings.sent2: Please don't alarm your grandmother with scary stories.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated gasp was meant to alarm his friends, but they just laughed.
meanings.sent4: The news of the approaching storm alarmed the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's sudden shout alarmed the students in the classroom.
